text:
Bartlett is a city in Labette County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 80 people lived there.
History.
Bartlett was platted in June 1886. It was named after one of its creators, Robert A. Bartlett.
The first post office in Bartlett was created in September 1886.
Bartlett was on the Missouri Pacific Railway.
Geography.
Bartlett is at (37.054922, -95.211588). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 80 people, 32 households, and 24 families living in Bartlett.
